name: Open Music
description: a visual programming, computer-aided composition environment. GPL3.

name: OM7
description: a new implementation of the OpenMusic visual programming and computer-aided composition environment including a number of improvements on graphical interface, computational mode, and connection to external software libraries. GPL3.

name: Incudine
description: Music/DSP programming environment for Common Lisp. Useful to design software synthesizers or sound plugins from scratch. It is also a compositional tool that allows to produce high quality sounds controllable at the sample level, defining and redefining the digital signal processors and the musical structures on-the-fly.

name: cl-collider
description: A

name: csound
description: A sound and music computing system. Includes CFFI and FFI interfaces for Common Lisp.

name: CLM
description: Common Lisp Music is a music synthesis and signal processing package in the Music V family. It provides much the same functionality as Stk, Csound, SuperCollider, PD, CMix, cmusic, and Arctic — a collection of functions that create and manipulate sounds, aimed primarily at composers (in CLM's case anyway).

name: cl-patterns
description: a system for composing music via Lisp code, heavily inspired by SuperCollider’s patterns system, with aims to implement much of it, but in a more robust, expressive, consistent, reflective, and lispy way. Audio output through SuperCollider, with preliminary support for Incudine, and MIDI through ALSA.

name: cl-openal
description: bindings for the OpenAL audio library. Public domain.

name: Common Music
description: the repository of an

name: Slippery Chicken
description: Algorithmic composition library which outputs Midi, Common Music Notation, pdf-score via Lilypond and sound via Common Lisp Music. GPL3.

name: Common Music Notation
description: Common Music Notation (CMN) provides a package of functions to hierarchically describe a musical score. Public domain.

name: cm-incudine
description: extends Common Music 2 with realtime capabilities. GPL2.

name: Mégra
description: A mini-language to make music with variable-order markov chains and some other stochastic shenanigans. GPL3.

name: Music
description: A framework for musical expression in Lisp with a focus on music theory (built from scratch, unrelated to Common Music).

name: rq
description: A library for rhythm transcription in OpenMusic (version 6.10 and later). demo video. GPL3.

name: scheduler
description: The time based musical event scheduler for Common Lisp. Apache2.0.

name: mixalot
description: Loosely-coupled collection of audio libraries for mp3, ogg vorbis, flac. Used for the Shuffletron music player. MIT.

name: osc
description: an implementation of the Open Sound Protocol. LGPL2.1.

name: Harmony
description: A real-time sound processing and playback system. zlib.

name: known ASDF extensions, such as asdf-system-connections, that lets you specify systems that are automatically loaded when two other systems are loaded, to connect them.
asdf-linguist
description: Extensions for ASDF. Expat.

name: asdf-viz
description: a tool to visualize the library dependencies of ASDF systems, the call graph of a function and the class inheritances. LLGPL.

name: April
description: The APL programming language (a subset thereof) compiling to Common Lisp. Replace hundreds of lines of number-crunching code with a single line of APL. Apache2.

name: cmacro
description: Lisp macros for C. MIT.

name: C-mera
description: a source-to-source compiler that utilizes Lisp's macro system for meta programming of C-like languages. GPL3.

name: lispc
description: a powerful "lispsy" macrolanguage for C. MIT.

name: with-c-syntax
description: a fun package which introduces the C language syntax into Common Lisp. (Yes, this package is not for practical coding, I think.) WTFPL Licence.

name: ecrepl
description: an interactive REPL for the C language. BSD_2Clause.

name: Software-Evolution-Library
description: The SEL enables the programmatic modification and evaluation of software (C/C++ support using Clang, compiled assembler, and linked ELF binaries). GPL3.

name: crypto-shortcuts
description: Collection of common crypto shortcuts. zlib.

name: trivial-ssh
description: An SSH client library. Expat.

name: cl-ssh-keys
description: Common Lisp system for generating and parsing of OpenSSH keys. BSD_3Clause.

name: cl-bcrypt
description: Common Lisp system for parsing and generating bcrypt password hashes. BSD_3Clause.

name: cl-monero-tools
description: Common Lisp toolbox to work with the Monero cryptocurrency. GPL3. Not in Quicklisp.

name: emotiq
description: a next-generation blockchain with an innovative natural-language approach to smart contracts. MIT.

name: peercoin-blockchain-parser
description: parse the blockchain contained in a file and export some of its data to a text file, a SQL script or a database. It can also create a database using the RPC of a Peercoin daemon as source of data instead of a blockchain file. LGPL3. Not in Quicklisp.

name: peercoin-calculator
description: This program gives you the probability of generating a POS or POW block within 10 minutes, 24 hours, 31 days, 90 days and 1 year, as well as the reward that can be expected. GUI in Qt. GPL3. Not in Quicklisp.

name: peercoin-vote
description: A voting system based on data from the blockchain (addresses and balances). GPL3. Not in Quicklisp.

name: cl-yesql
description: SQL statements live in their own files, in SQL syntax, and are imported into Lisp as functions. You are not limited to the features a DSL supports. Based on Clojure's Yesql. MIT.

name: cl-dbi
description: A database-independent interface for Common Lisp. LLGPL.

name: dbd-oracle
description: an Oracle database driver for CL-DBI. LLGPL.

name: crane
description: Another ORM. Expat.

name: datafly
description: A lightweight database library. 3-clause BSD.

name: sxql
description: A DSL for generating SQL. 3-clause BSD.

name: bknr.datastore
description: a CLOS-based lisp-only database in RAM with transaction logging persistence. Manual. licence.

name: see also this good introductory blog post
an example web application using bknr.datastore: screenshotbot-oss.
ubiquitous
description: A library providing easy-to-use persistent configuration storage. zlib.

name: cl-prevalence
description: in-memory database system. Implementation of Object Prevalence, in which business objects are kept live in memory and transactions are journaled for system recovery. github fork. LLGPL. See also cl-prevalence-multimaster, to syncronize multiple cl-prevalence systems state.

name: cl-agraph, a minimal client for AllegroGraph. AllegroGraph is a horizontally distributed, multi-model (document and graph), entity-event knowledge graph technology. It is proprietary and has a free version with a limit of 5 million triples.
neo4cl
description: a library for interacting with Neo4J. Sends Cypher queries to a Neo4J server, and decodes the responses into something useful for processing in CL. Apache2.

name: and maybe: cl-neo4j
description: a thin neo4j RESTFUL client interface.

name: vivace-graph
description: graph database & Prolog implementation. Takes design inspiration from CouchDB, neo4j and AllegroGraph. It implements an ACID-compliant object graph model with user-defined indexes and map-reduce views. It also implements a master / slave replication scheme for redundancy and horizontal read scaling. Querying the graph is accomplished via a number of Lisp methods or via a Prolog-like query language. MIT.

name: facts
description: an in-memory graph database with transactions and rollbacks, logging/replay and dumping/loading to/from disk. BSD-style license (ISC).

name: restagraph
description: an app that dynamically generates REST APIs for a Neo4j database, using a schema defined within the database. GPL3.

name: cl-sqlite
description: Bindings for SQLite. Public domain.

name: cl-memcached
description: Fast, thread-safe interface to the Memcached object caching system. Expat.

name: cl-mongo
description: MongoDB client. Expat.

name: cl-redis
description: Redis client. Expat.

name: cl-disque
description: Disque client. 3-clause BSD.

name: cl-rethinkdb
description: RethinkDB client. Expat.

name: cl-mango
description: A minimalist CouchDB 2.x database client. BSD_3Clause. See also clouchdb - Library for interacting with CouchDB. FreeBSD.

name: lmdb
description: Bindings to LMDB, the Lightning Memory-mapped Database, an ACID key-value database with MultiVersion Concurrency Control.

name: cl-migratum
description: a system which provides facilities for performing database schema migrations, designed to work with various databases. BSD_3Clause.

name: postmodern-passenger-pigeon
description: a migration manager for postmodern. No licence specified.

name: dyna
description: an AWS DynamoDB ORM. MIT.

name: cl-influxdb
description: an interface to the Time Series Database InfluxDB. MIT.

name: pzmq
description: ZeroMQ 4.0+ Common Lisp bindings. Unlicense.

name: pgloader
description: a data loading tool for PostgreSQL. PostgreSQL Licence.

name: trivial-extensible-sequences
description: Portability library for the extensible sequences protocol (SBCL documentation). zlib.

name: bst
description: Binary Search Tree. GPL3.

name: pileup
description: a portable, performant, and thread-safe binary heap for Common Lisp. MIT.

name: sycamore
description: a fast, purely functional data structure library. BSD_3Clause.

name: genhash – hash table implementation with API from generic methods. Public domain.
cl-ctrie
description: lock-free, concurrent, key/value index with efficient memory-mapped persistence and fast transient storage models. MIT.

name: cl-data-structures
description: a portable collection of data structures and algorithms (mainly dicts and sequences, with some statistical functions). BSD.

name: listopia
description: a list manipulation library inspired by Haskell's Data.List. LLGPL.

name: hash-set
description: a convenience library implementing hash sets on top of CL hash tables The Unlicense

name: cl-containers
description: an extensive library of data structures and utilities - queues, trees, heaps, doubly-linked lists, sets, bags,... MIT

name: cl-competitive
description: Common Lisp algorithms collection for competitive programming. Public domain, CCO or MIT.

name: modf
description: a setf-like macro for functional programming.

name: bitfield
description: Efficiently represent several finite sets or small integers as a single non-negative integer. MIT.

name: cl-docker-images
description: Docker images for ABCL, CCL, ECL, and SBCL on Windows (amd64) and Alpine and Debian (amd64, arm64, arm/v7) BSD_2Clause.

name: base-lisp-image
description: base

name: cl-bindgen
description: A command line tool and library for creating Common Lisp language bindings from C header files. MIT.

name: cl-gobject-introspection
description: Gobject Introspection FFI. Automatic bindings to call into the C library. BSD. Generate a lisp interface with gir2cl. LGPL3.

name: cl-cxx-jit
description: Common Lisp and C++ interoperation with JIT. MIT.

name: ABCLJ
description: dead easy  Clojure to Common lisp interop. EPL-2.0.

name: CLERIC
description: a Common Lisp Erlang Interface. An implementation of the Erlang distribution protocol, comparable with erl_interface and jinterface. MIT.

name: cl+j
description: A JNI-based interface to a JVM via CFFI. Not available on Quicklisp. Does not reliably work with all implementations. Expat.

name: objc-lisp-bridge
description: A portable reader and bridge for interacting with Objective-C and Cocoa. MIT.

name: burgled-batteries
description: A bridge between Python and Common Lisp. The goal is that Lisp programs can use Python libraries. Not available on Quicklisp. MIT.

name: cl4py
description: The library cl4py (pronounce as clappy) allows Python programs to call Common Lisp libraries. MIT.

name: py4cl
description: A library that allows Common Lisp code to access Python libraries. It is basically the inverse of cl4py. MIT.

name: cl-python
description: an implementation of Python in Common Lisp. LLGPL.

name: Bike
description: a cross-platform .Net Core interface. MIT.

name: Foil
description: A foreign object interface; works with the JVM and CLI. Not available on Quicklisp. CPL 1.0.

name: Xelf
description: Extensible game library. Not available on Quicklisp. GNU LGPL2.1.

name: Trial
description: Trial is an OpenGL game engine with a heavy focus on modularity. It is supposed to provide a large toolkit of useful bits and pieces from which you can create a game. zlib.

name: cl-mpg123 and cl-out123, bindings libraries for libmpg123 and libout123 respectively, giving you fast and easy to use mp3 decoding and cross-platform audio output. zlib.
trivial-gamekit – with this small framework you would be able to make simple 2D games: draw basic geometric forms, images and text, play sounds and listen to mouse and keyboard input. MIT.
cl-gamepad
description: Access to gamepads and joysticks on Windows, Mac OS, and Linux. zlib.

name: virality
description: A component-based game engine written in Common Lisp MIT.

name: common-cv
description: the OpenCV (Open Source Computer Vision Library) binding library for CommonLisp. No license specified.

name: cl-cairo2
description: Cairo bindings. Boost 1.0

name: cl-gd
description: A library providing an interface to the GD graphics library. FreeBSD.

name: cl-horde3d
description: FFI bindings to the Horde3D graphics library. Not available on Quicklisp. EPL 1.0

name: cl-jpeg
description: Baseline JPEG encoder and decoder library. 3-clause BSD.

name: cl-liballegro
description: Interface and bindings to the Allegro 5 game programming library. zlib.

name: cl-opengl
description: CFFI bindings to OpenGL, GLU and GLUT APIs. 3-clause BSD.

name: cl-sdl2
description: Bindings for SDL2 using C2FFI. Expat.

name: cl-svg
description: A basic library for producing SVG files. Expat.

name: CLinch
description: Common Lisp 2D/3D graphics engine for OpenGL. FreeBSD.

name: donuts
description: Graph drawing DSL for Common Lisp. Expat.

name: dufy
description: exact color manipulation and conversion in various color models. MIT.

name: lispbuilder-sdl
description: A set of bindings for SDL. Expat.

name: lisp-magick-wand
description: ImageMagick bindings. BSD. Not in Quicklisp.

name: okra
description: CFFI bindings to Ogre. Not available on Quicklisp. 3-clause BSD.

name: opticl
description: a library for representing and processing images. BSD_2Clause.

name: Varjo
description: Lisp to GLSL translator. BSD_2Clause.

name: Vecto
description: Simple vector drawing library. FreeBSD.

name: zpng
description: A library for creating PNG files. FreeBSD.

name: pngload-fast
description: A PNG (Portable Network Graphics) image format decoder in portable Common Lisp with an emphasis on speed. MIT.

name: cl-cuda
description: A library to use NVIDIA CUDA in Common Lisp programs. LLGPL.

name: LispWork's CAPI
description: A portable GUI toolkit, with mobile runtime. Proprietary, but comes with a free version.

name:
Allegro's Common Graphics- a library of functions for writing windowized GUIs for Windows, Mac and Linux. Proprietary with a free version.

since Allegro 10.1 (March, 2022), the IDE and the Common Graphics toolkit runs in the browser.
since Allegro 10.1 (March, 2022), the IDE and the Common Graphics toolkit runs in the browser.
LTk Examples
description: Provides LTk examples for the tkdocs tutorial.

name: LTk Plotchart
description: A wrapper around the tklib/plotchart library to work with LTk. This includes over 20 different chart types (xy-plots, gantt charts, 3d-bar charts etc...).

name: IUP
description: CFFI bindings to the IUP Portable User Interface library (pre-ALPHA). IUP is cross-platform (Windows, macOS, GNU/Linux, with new Android, iOs, Cocoa and Web Assembly drivers), has many widgets, has a small api and is actively developed.

name: nodgui
description: Bindings for the Tk toolkit, based on Ltk, with syntax sugar and additional widgets. LLGPL.

name: cl-cffi-gtk
description: Binding for GTK+3. GNU LGPL2.1.

name: a tutorial: Learn Common Lisp by Example: GTK GUI with SBCL
cl-gtk2
description: A binding for GTK+2. LLGPL.

name: ceramic
description: Desktop web apps with Electron. Expat.

name: Electron-lisp-boilerplate
description: A rudimentary boilerplate for building Electron apps with embedded Lisp helper processes.

name: CocoaInterface
description: Cocoa interface for Clozure Common Lisp. Build Cocoa user interface

name: McCLIM
description: An implementation of the Common Lisp Interface Manager, version II. GNU LGPL2.1.

name: cl-webkit
description: A binding to WebKitGTK+. Also adds web browsing capabilities to an application, leveraging the full power of the WebKit browsing engine. MIT.

name: ftw
description: A Win32 GUI library. MIT.

name: eql, eql5, eql5-android
description: Embedded Qt4 and Qt5 Lisp, embedded in ECL, embeddable in Qt. Port of EQL5 to the Android platform. MIT.

name: bodge-nuklear
description: Wrapper over the Nuklear immediate mode GUI library. MIT.

name: file-select
description: A library to invoke the native system file dialog to select or create files. Zlib.

name: LispWork's mobile runtime
description: Android and iOs.  Proprietary.

name: LQML
description: a lightweight ECL binding to QML (both Qt5 and Qt6) derived from EQL5. LGPL and public domain.

name: see also: sbcl-librarian
description: Dynamic library delivery tools for SBCL. MIT. Blog post. Full example.

name: ECL
description: Embeddable Common Lisp; compiles to C. GNU LGPL2.1.

name: ABCL
description: Armed Bear Common Lisp; targets the JVM, compiles to bytecode. Standard conformance. GNU GPL3 with Classpath exception.

name: CLASP
description: a new Common Lisp implementation that seamlessly interoperates with C++ libraries and programs using LLVM for compilation to native code. This allows Clasp to take advantage of a vast array of preexisting libraries and programs, such as out of the scientific computing ecosystem. LGPL2.1 (and others).

name: LispWorks
description: an integrated cross-platform development tool for Common Lisp.

name: Allegro CL
description: provides the full ANSI Common Lisp standard with many extensions.

name: MOCL
description: CL as a library for mobile devices (iOS & Android) and OSX.

name: CMUCL
description: An implementation from Carnegie Mellon University. Public domain. SBCL is a fork of CMUCL.

name: GNU CLISP
description: A GNU implementation; contains a compiler and an interpreter. Standard conformance. GNU GPL3.

name: Corman Lisp
description: a Common Lisp development environment for Microsoft Windows running on Intel platforms. MIT.

name: jonathan
description: A JSON encoder and decoder. MIT.

name: cl-json
description: A highly customizable JSON encoder and decoder. MIT.

name: jsown
description: A reader and writer for the JSON format. Expat.

name: json-mop
description: A metaclass for bridging CLOS and JSON objects. MIT.

name: cl-json-pointer
description: A JSON Pointer implementation. MIT.

name: cl-yacclyaml
description: a pure lisp YAML processor (loader, but not yet dumper). GPL3.

name: cl-yaml
description: a YAML parser and emitter built on top of libyaml. MIT.

name: serapeum
description: Another general-purpose utility library. Expat.

name: rutils
description: radical yet reasonable syntactic utilities for Common Lisp. MIT.

name: anaphora
description: A collection of anaphoric macros. Public domain.

name: arrow-macros
description: Clojure-like threading macros. MIT.

name: dissect
description: when a lot of projects use the “trivial-backtrace” system that just gives them a string with a backtrace, Dissect allows you to capture, step, and completely inspect the stack trace on a variety of Lisp implementations. Also very useful for logging and other situations where execution is automatically continued, but the information of the current stack is still useful to store somewhere. zlib.

name: generic-cl
description: Generic function interface to standard Common Lisp functions (equality, comparison, arithmetic, objects, iterator, sequences,…). MIT. See also the more lightweight generic-comparability. LLGPL.

name: hu.dwim.walker
description: a code walker and unwalker (aka AST parser and unparser). BSD. See also this blog post.

name: trivial-arguments
description: A portable library to retrieve the arguments list of a function. zlib.

name: definitions
description: a general definitions introspection library. It gives you the ability to retrieve definitions or bindings associated with designators such as symbols, packages, and names in general. zlib.

name: cl21
description: An experimental project to move Common Lisp into the 21st century. Expat.

name: clamp
description: Arc language's brevity and conciseness to Common Lisp. Artistic License 2.0.

name: cl-syntax
description: Reader syntax conventions. LLGPL.

name: cl-2dsyntax
description: An indentation-sensitive reader system. Not available on Quicklisp. Public domain.

name: cl-annot
description: Python-like annotations for Common Lisp. LLGPL.

name: pythonic-string-reader
description: A simple and unobtrusive read table modification inspired by Python's three quote strings. BSD_3Clause.

name: cl-reader
description: A utility library

name: defclass-std
description: a shortcut macro to write DEFCLASS forms quickly. LLGPL.

name: specialization-store
description: generic functions based on types. Simplified BSD License variant.

name: filtered-functions
description: enable the use of arbitrary predicates for selecting and applying methods. MIT.

name: inlined-generic-function
description: Bringing the speed of Static Dispatch to CLOS. LLGPL.

name: static-dispatch
description: allows standard generic function dispatch to be performed statically (at compile time) rather than dynamically (runtime). This is similar to what is known as "overloading" in languages such as C++ and Java. MIT.

name: dynamic-mixins
description: simple, dynamic class combination. BSD_2Clause.

name: fast-generic-functions
description: Seal your generic functions for an extra boost in performance. MIT.

name: polymorphic functions
description: A function type to dispatch on types instead of classes with partial support for dispatching on optional and keyword argument types. Still experimental (May, 2021). MIT.

name: slot-extra-options
description: lets you build a metaclass which in turn lets you specify extra slot options in its classes. LGPL3.

name: cl-hooks
description: Hooks extension point mechanism (as known, e.g., from GNU Emacs). LGPL.

name: method-hooks
description: When CLOS method combination allow only one hook per method, this library allows an arbitrary number of them. Mozilla Public Licence.

name: cl-advice
description: an attempt of portable layer advice library for SBCL, CCL, LispWorks and Allegro. Not in Quicklisp.

name: for
description: A concise, lispy and extensible iteration macro. Unlike loop it is extensible and sensible, and unlike iterate it does not require code-walking and is easier to extend. zlib.

name: series
description: Functional style without any runtime penalty at all. MIT.

name: gmap
description: A concise and extensible iteration facility that has the advantage of integrating well with FSet (see the Data Structures section), as it was written by the same author. In Quicklisp as part of misc-extensions. Public domain.

name: trivial-do
description: Additional dolist style macros for Common Lisp. MIT.

name: doplus – another extensible iteration library, similar to :for.
snakes
description: Python style generators for Common Lisp. Includes a port of itertools. Apache2.

name: picl
description: An (almost) complete port of Python's itertools package, complete with laziness where applicable, and not relying on cl-cont. MIT.

name: gtwiwtg
description: A lazy sequences library. Similar to 'series' but not as complete. However it has a 'modern' API with stuff like take, filter, for, fold, etc. that is easy to use.

name: fn
description: a couple of lambda shorthand macros. (fn* (+ _ _))  -->  (lambda (_) (+ _ _)). Public domain.

name: f-underscore
description: a tiny library of functional programming utils. (f_ (+ _ _)) -> (lambda (_) (+ _ _)). Public domain.

name: cl-punch
description: Scala-like anonymous lambda literals. (mapcar ^(* 2 _) '(1 2 3 4 5)). MIT.

name: cl-prolog2
description: Common Interface to ISO Prolog implementations from Common Lisp. MIT.

name: Screamer
description: augment Common

name: Screamer+
description: increasing the expressiveness of SCREAMER. MIT.

name: Temperance
description: logic programming. MIT. A focus on performance, with General Game Playing in mind.

name: Cells
description: an implementation of the dataflow programming paradigm, reactive spreadsheet-like expressiveness for CLOS. Used to build an algebra learning system. With documentation. Lisp LGPL.

name: quid-pro-quo
description: a contract

name: cl-algebraic-data-type
description: A library for defining algebraic data types in a similar spirit to Haskell or ML. 3-clause BSD.

name: defstar
description: a collection of macros for easy inclusion of type declarations for arguments in lambda lists. GNU GPL3

name: Learn X in Y minutes
description: Where X = Common Lisp - Small Common Lisp tutorial covering the essentials.

name: Lisp Koans
description: The project guides the learner progressively through many Common Lisp language features.

name: Practical Common Lisp
description: A good introductory text to Common Lisp, with practical examples. Better read with a Firefox add-on.

name: Common LISP: A Gentle Introduction to Symbolic Computation
description: A nice introduction into the language.

name: Successful Lisp
description: A good book for beginners with some programming background.

name: Lisp Quickstart
description: A good tutorial to get up and code Common Lisp quickly.

name: Casting SPELs in LISP
description: A fun way to learn LISP while reading a comic book.

name: Lisp Tips
description: A blog with useful tips and tricks. A continuation of Common Lisp tips.

name: Lisp project of the day
description: A blog showcasing many Lisp libraries.

name: Let Over Lambda
description: A book on advanced macro techniques. The first six chapters are available online.

name: On Lisp
description: Paul Graham's amazing book on Lisp macros (and other interesting things).

name: Programming Algorithms in Lisp
description: Updated version of "Programming Algorithms"; A comprehensive guide to writing efficient programs with data structures and algorithms in Lisp.

name: Lisp for the Web
description: A book that walks you through building a voting web application in three tiers.

name: Lisp Web Tales
description: Simple tutorials using hunchentoot, cl-redis, restas, SEXML, Postmodern, and more.

name: Section on Web Development in The Common Lisp Cookbook
description: An introductory tutorial covering web server setup, routing, weblocks, templating, error handling, packaging, hot reloading, database connection, and deployment, amongst other topics in the current lisp web development ecosystem.

name: Common Lisp Quick Reference
description: A distilled, pocket-size version of the ANSI CL spec. Available for download as a PDF.

name: CLHS
description: The Common Lisp HyperSpec; the ANSI CL standard, in hypertext form.

name: CLOS MOP specification
description: A modern public domain online version of chapters 5 and 6 of The Art of the Metaobject Protocol

name: Common Lisp Standard Draft (pdf)
description: The standard draft of the Common Lisp specifications, in a well formatted PDF with a sidebar.

name: Common Lisp the Language
description: The original standard for Common Lisp before the ANSI spec.

name: Minispec
description: A friendlier, but less-complete, version of CLHS. Also contains documentation for some commonly-used CL libraries (such as Alexandria).

name: Simplified Common Lisp reference
description: The simplified version of CLHS.

name: CDR
description: Common Lisp Document Repository. a repository of documents that are of interest to the Common Lisp community. The most important property of a CDR document is that it will never change: if you refer to it, you can be sure that your reference will always refer to exactly the same document.

name: the Common Lisp Document Repository is hosted at Zenodo.
Land of Lisp
description: A fun, game-oriented introduction to Common Lisp.

name: Practical Common Lisp
description: A good introductory text to Common Lisp, with practical examples.

name: ANSI Common Lisp
description: A thorough, practical covering of the entire language, with exercises. Not recommended as a starter text, due to some caveats.

name: Common Lisp Recipes
description: Common Lisp Recipes is a collection of solutions to problems and answers to questions you are likely to encounter when writing real-world applications in Common Lisp. Published in 2015.

name: Let Over Lambda
description: A book on advanced macro techniques. All eight chapters are available in the print copy.

name: Object-Oriented Programming in Common Lisp: A Programmer's Guide to CLOS
description: An old, but very thorough book on CLOS.

name: Paradigms of Artificial Intelligence Programming: Case Studies in Common Lisp
description: A book on programming AI that covers some advanced Lisp.

name: Building Problem Solvers (PDF) by Ken Forbus and Johan de Kleer, made available for free by MIT Press
description: a  unique book among standard artificial intelligence texts in combining science and engineering, theory and craft to describe the construction of AI reasoning systems, and including code illustrating the ideas.

name: /r/Common_Lisp
description: subreddit about Common Lisp

name: /r/learnlisp
description: a subreddit to ask questions and get help about Lisp

name: #commonlisp on Libera Chat
description: main Common Lisp IRC channel.

name: #lisp on Libera Chat
description: IRC channel for all Lisp dialects.

name: Planet Lisp
description: A meta blog that collects the contents of various Lisp-related blogs.

name: Common Lisp chat
description: Keybase team with well-defined rules and retention policies.

name: CLPM
description: A package manager for Common Lisp that strives to cleanly separate the package manager process itself from the client image that uses it. BSD_2Clause.

name: Ultralisp
